Directions & Hours
Junior Theater Festival Performance Team!
Are you ready to elevate your passion for the stage to new heights? The Players Studio invites you to audition for our Broadway Competition Team‚Äì a dynamic group designed to empower aspiring talents and set them on a path to becoming better well rounded performers with the potential for a career in performing arts.
üåü
What Sets Us Apart:
‚ú®
Expert Guidance:
Our ensemble is led by professionals who bring years of experience and beyond. Receive personalized coaching in singing, dancing, acting, to refine your skills and unlock your full potential. Guest teachers will be brought in to work and coach the group.
üåü
‚ú®
Showcase on Renowned Stages:
As a member of The Players Studio Competition Team, you‚Äôll have the chance to shine on prestigious stages. Participating in events such as Access Broadway, Junior Theater Festival, Thespians, and other celebrated competitions as a solo artist and as an ensemble.
üåü
‚ú®
No Class tuition:
There are no membership fees to be a part of The Team, However, please note that there are Fees associated for costs for travel, competition fees and registration, and costumes/gear.
üåü
‚ú®
Community and Camaraderie:
Join our vibrant community of like-minded individuals who share your passion for the performing arts. Forge lasting friendships, collaborate on exciting projects, and be a part of a supportive network that encourages artistic growth.
üåü
‚ú®
Ensemble First, Competition Second:
While we embrace the thrill of competition, our commitment to being an ensemble comes first. We believe that the true measure of our success is not just the awards we may bring home but the shared moments of passion, dedication, and artistic expression that make us a formidable force on and off the stage.
Together, we rise, shine, and create something magical.
üåü
Enroll Here!
Junior Theater Festival Performance Team!
AGES 10-18
We are ecstatic to announce that The Players Studio will be attending the Junior Theater Festival again in January 2026!¬† This group will perform a 15-minute cut of our soon to be announced Jr production at the Festival!
The Junior Theater Festival (JTF) is the premier platform for young musical theater enthusiasts to display their talents. Imagine an action-packed weekend where student groups from across the globe come together to celebrate the art of musical theater. Each team performs a dynamic 15-minute segment from a Broadway Junior¬Æ production and receives constructive feedback from a panel of musical theater professionals. The festival also includes workshops for students, parents, and educators, previews of upcoming musicals, and culminates in a dazzling concert featuring top Broadway performers
Rehearsals:
Week Intensive:
September 1-September 6, 6pm-9pm daily ‚Äì Saturday 1:30-4pm
Regular Rehearsals:
Mondays 6-9pm ‚Äì Saturdays 1:30-4pm
Production Dates
(regular rehearsal times included)
Performance: December 12-13
Extended Rehearsals:
December 6-11
JTF performance: ¬†January 16-18 in Atlanta
Extended Rehearsals
**Possible Rehearsals during second week of Winter break, January 12-14
Cost-
Tuition/registration: $900
Includes:
‚Äì Materials and licensing fees
in house production
‚Äì Show Shirt
‚Äì
Bracelets for trading with other schools at JTF.
ADDITIONAL COSTS
Tickets: $400/person (including parents attending and watching performance)
Hotel: $825/room
Flights: $300-$400
Transportation: $100/person
Payments:
$400/person due at time of enrollment for ticket purchase. PARENTS ATTENDING MUST ALSO ENROLL!
$825 hotel fee due September 10th
$100 transportation fee
Monthly Payments available for the remaining $900 (between August and December)
Addition costs not included: food, merch, personal supplies
Commitment to team:
Once cast, students are required to attend rehearsals and to rehearse at home. This group is a commitment and requires students to dedicate time to create a cohesive team. Constant missing of rehearsals may result in removal of role/from the show. This is also a financial commitment, and once the initial payments are received we will be purchasing tickets and they are non-refundable. Plane tickets, travel costs, food, and hotel will also be additional costs.
Auditions:
First Day of Intensive September 1
Prepare: o
ne song from the show‚Ä¶See below
Dress:
Please dress ready to dance and move. Wear appropriate dance shoes and clothing.
Callbacks will be held if necessary
Roles to Audition For:
Baker-
It Takes Two
Bakers Wife-
It Takes Two
Witch-
Witches Rap
Cinderella-
Steps of the Palace
Little Red-
I Know Things Now
Jack-
Giants in the Sky
Jacks mom-Opening
Cinderellas Prince-
Agony
Rapunzels Prince-
Agony
(Additional smaller roles will be cast)
Travel Info:
All team members must arrive in Atlanta Friday Morning, January 16th. The Players Team will be arriving Thursday evening, so all students traveling with us will need to fly out with us and plan to stay until Monday morning. 4 nights. Students traveling with parents can arrive Thursday or Friday, but it must be Friday morning. There are activities starting early Friday.
Transportation cost and planning is the responsibility of each family. We will have group rates for transportation and hotel available in August. We recommend utilizing these options as it is fun for students to travel together! Room share, carpooling is always an option for families and can save the total cost/family.
Hotel: Marriot Northwest (Booked) Breakfast included!
Team Leader:
Thayer Greenberg
Questions?
Contact Thayer Greenberg at 941.552.8879 or by emailing thayerg@theplayers.org.
Enroll Here!

Support Us
The Sarasota Players offers many ways for our valued patrons and community to get involved!
‚Äì The performing arts changes lives every class, every show, every day ‚Äì
The Sarasota Players impacts thousands of people, from young children to seniors, across the region yearly via extraordinary shows, classes and workshops that foster creativity and artistic inclusion. Our community theatre continues to grow a nearly century-long legacy because of your support, whether it‚Äôs through pledging your valuable time or a generous contribution toward carrying on our outstanding indoor and outdoor performances, galas, educational programs and more. Join us in building The Players Centre‚Äôs future and explore the how you can donate today!
Contribute to live theatre in Sarasota
donate
Our Donors help make each show possible! Without your generous contributions, the stage would be dark, the orchestra silent, and the curtain would never rise. Help keep the dream alive and become a donor today!
donate today!
our sponsors
The generous and continuous support of our Sponsors helps us continue to bring quality community theatre productions to the Sarasota area. We encourage everyone to take a moment to thank the sponsors who make our shows possible!
check out our sponsors
fundraisers
The Sarasota Players presents exciting fundraisers to help our theatre grow and thrive. From shows to galas, our fundraisers always entertain! Check out what fundraisers you can be a part of this season!
fundraisers
donate

fundraisers
The Sarasota Players presents exciting fundraisers to help our theatre grow and thrive. From shows to galas, our fundraisers always entertain! Check out what fundraisers you can be a part of this season!
fundraisers
Ovation Circle
Donate over $1,000 to The Sarasota Players and gain  access to behind-the-scenes content and events
Join the Ovation Circle
Sponsor a Series
Help us produce our 94th Season, Summer Series, and Sarasota Players Studio shows.
Sponsor a Series
more info
Sponsor a Show
Help us produce your favorite show, or a show you‚Äôve always wanted to see on stage! Whatever the reason is, play your part in getting a production on its feet.
Sponsor a Show
more info
Be an Annual Donor
Be an Annual Donor
Help us continue our mission of entertaining, educating and engaging the entire community, year after year.
Be an Annual Donor
more info
Be an Encore Member
Encore gifts are monthly, ongoing contributions, and their predictability enables us to make plans and commitments with confidence.
Be an Encore Member
For more information call Morgan Gerhart at 941.365.2494 or email below
email for more info
Join the 1929 Legacy Society
By leaving a planned gift to the theatre, you ensure the thrivability of your community theatre. These gifts enable us to continue to be a leader in live theater and youth education programs.
Join the 1929 Legacy Society
For more information call Morgan Gerhart at 941.365.2494 or email below
Email for more info
The Building Better Grown Ups Scholarship Fund
This fund allows The Sarasota Players to adhere to their policy that no child is ever turned away for their inability to pay.
The Building Better Grown Ups Scholarship Fund
more info

Check out more ways to help out The Sarasota Players!

Our History

Careers
Directions & Hours
meet the team
meet the team
William Skaggs
CEO
William Skaggs joined The Sarasota Players as CEO in September 2020 bringing extensive experience in philanthropy, operations, and financial services in higher education and performing arts contexts. Originally from Hazard, KY, William is a two-time graduate of Western Kentucky University (BA in Music and MBA). William embraces a broad view of the value of the arts to a community via entertainment, education, and economic impacts.
William previously served as Chief Development Officer at Southern Kentucky Performing Arts Center (SKyPAC) in Bowling Green, KY. SKyPAC serves 300,000 people in Southcentral Kentucky via a 1,700-seat mainstage theatre and 200 seat studio theatre with Broadway tours, concerts, and educational programming. SKyPAC experienced record totals of top-level donors and new sponsor commitments during each year of William‚Äôs tenure.
Before his time at SKyPAC, William was a Financial Advisor with Mass Mutual serving individuals and families in planning, protection, and investing. Beginning with no book of business, William achieved Rising Leaders in his first six months and the Mass Mutual Leaders Conference at the conclusion of his first ten months.
Willliam spent twelve years in philanthropy and alumni relations roles at WKU during portions of two comprehensive campaigns totaling more than $300 million. Among those roles was responsibility in campaign, planning, and construction for¬†the Martens Alumni Center, the anchor in a mixed-use development that included hotel, parking, residential, and restaurant projects. William completed his time at WKU with concurrent appointments as Director of Annual Giving and Director of Alumni Resources, overseeing Alumni Association budgets and operations while planning and implementing the university‚Äôs centralized and comprehensive annual giving program.
William enjoys his family, traveling, Broadway musicals, and college football. He resides in Sarasota with his beautiful wife Jenny, three amazing children, and two spoiled dogs.
email
Amy Gorman
Director of Development
Amy joined The Sarasota Players as the Director of Development after nineteen years in philanthropy in the education arena. Originally from New York, Amy graduated with a BA in English from the State University of NY at Stony Brook and a JD from the State University of NY at Buffalo School of Law.
Before her career in educational advancement, Amy was a financial underwriter for CNA Insurance Companies in NY, serving large financial institutions. Amy served as Assistant Director of the Annual Fund and Director of the Parents‚Äô Fund at The Taft School in Watertown CT.
Upon relocating to the Sarasota area, Amy joined the SCF Foundation as the Corporate Relations Associate responsible for the solicitation of major gifts, donor stewardship, and special event planning. Subsequently, Amy was the Director of Development at Cardinal Mooney Catholic High School.
Amy serves on the board of Sisterhood for Good, a local nonprofit philanthropic organization. She enjoys spending time with her family, friends, and her dog, Maeve, a sweet Airedale Terrier.
email
Amanda Heisey
Marketing & PR Director
Originally from Kansas City, Amanda attended the¬†University of Missouri-Columbia¬†where she earned a¬†Bachelors of Journalism degree. After moving to Sarasota to work as the web editor for The Business Observer, she then went on to become the Communications Manager for the Arts and Cultural Alliance of Sarasota County which began her steps back into the world of her first love, the arts.
As the Marketing Director¬†for The Sarasota Players, she¬†is responsible for social media, website maintenance, press releases,¬†print and digital advertising, playbills, graphic design,¬†and brand management.
She is also a local director and performer for various theatres in the area and produces burlesque for Hard Heart Burlesque under the persona Karma Kandlewick. Amanda teaches the Adult Burlesque class at The Players Studio and has private acting students as well as burlesque students.
email
Brian Finnerty
Production manager
Brian has worked in the theatre and educational arts for¬†15 years as a production manager, director, choreographer, instructor, stage manager, costume & scenic designer, and performer. He‚Äôs won numerous awards for¬†his direction, choreography, costume design, and performing including Herald Tribune Handy Awards and Broadway World‚Äôs Best Costume Design and Choreography. Brian has trained under performing arts icons such as the choreographer for¬†Broadway‚Äôs
Moulin Rouge
, Sonya Tayeh and So You Think You Can Dance‚Äôs Anthony Morigerato. He‚Äôs the Co-Artistic Director for¬†Dingbat Theatre Project and has worked artistically on many original works such as Big Red Nose Burlesque and Plump Sisters Productions. His role is to manage and facilitate all productions to result in clean and creative theatrical experiences. A native to Florida, Brian‚Äôs educational background includes Booker High School‚Äôs Visual and Performing Arts Program and Point Park University Conservatory of Performing Arts.
email
Jill CAstle
Costume Shop Manager
Jill has been designing, sewing and performing on stage since a very young age, originally from the Adirondacks in upstate New York she has a BFA from Syracuse University in Fiber Arts. Her artwork and performances have been displayed in many university publications and galleries.
While living in the Midwest her designs were published in the KC Star as well as through various fashion shows sponsored by vintage shops, quilt shops and nightclubs. She started performing belly dance and costuming in the mid 2000‚Äôs while forming an uplifting women‚Äôs dance group which raised funds for the local cancer center in upstate New York. While in New Hampshire she taught at Raq-On Dance Studio and performed throughout Vermont and Massachusetts. Here in Florida she has worked with Hip Expressions Belly Dance Studio in St Petersburg since 2013 and found her chosen family in performance artists.
Within the theatre world she has sewn for Norwegian Cruise Lines in Riverview FL, Kansas City Costume Company MO, Capital Rep/Proctors in Albany NY and as the Costume Shop Manager and Designer for American Stage Theatre Company in St Pete from 2016 to 2021. Notable awards are for Best Costume Design for Skeleton Crew by Theater Tampa Bay, and voted Costume Design of the Decade for American Stage‚Äôs
Mamma Mia!
by BroadwayWorld.com.
When not sitting in front of a sewing machine Jill spends her time as a belly dancer and instructor and as a variety entertainer through her company Miss Bean Entertainment.
email

Thayer Greenberg
Director of Education
Thayer Greenberg is a lifelong educator with a commitment to educational excellence. She holds a bachelor‚Äôs degree in educational arts administration from UMASS Amherst and is currently persuing a master‚Äôs in organizational leadership at the University of Colorado Boulder. With a background of over 15 years in the field of education, she has honed her expertise through immersive experiences in vibrant cultural hubs like Chicago and New York City.¬† In her role as the Director of Education at The Players Studio, Thayer oversees the daily operations of the Education Department, creating and implementing new programs and curriculum with her team and ensuring the studio is a safe inviting place for¬†students to come and explore the art of performance.¬† Beyond her professional endeavors, Thayer finds joy in singing, and cooking! With a passion for¬†both nurturing young minds and fostering creativity, Thayer is excited to continue cultivating the Players Studio!
email
Jason Ellis
Assistant Director of Operations
With over a decade of experience in operations leadership, Jason Ellis brings a sharp focus on strategy, structure, and customer excellence to every organization he supports. His career includes leadership roles such as District Manager in Florida‚Äôs medical cannabis industry and management positions with The Ritz-Carlton, where he developed a deep understanding of premium service and team development.
A Bradenton, Florida native, Jason is equally passionate about the arts. For more than 15 years, he has been an active figure in the local theatre scene. He studied Theatre and Business Management at the State College of Florida, building a dual path as both a professional and volunteer performer. His stage credits span regional musical theatre, immersive cabaret, and variety entertainment. He also performs as his alter ego,
Swanky Valli
, frequently emceeing for local burlesque troupes including Hard Heart Burlesque and Big Red Nose Burlesque.
The Sarasota Players was the first community theatre where Jason found both a stage and a sense of belonging. Returning now in a leadership capacity, he‚Äôs honored to blend his professional expertise with his artistic passion in support of an institution that helped shape his journey. For him, this role is more than a job‚Äîit‚Äôs a meaningful homecoming and a chance to give back to the theatre that gave him his start.
email
SCOTT SCHUSTER
Technical Director
Scott
‚Äôs love for community theater began in New Mexico, where he explored acting, singing, and dancing with both the Albuquerque Civic Light Opera Association and the Albuquerque Little Theatre.
Throughout his career,
Scott
has been fortunate to work professionally in vibrant theater, film, and television communities across the country including a national tour with The Boston Chamber Theater, portraying Ichabod Crane in
The Legend of Sleepy Hollow
.
In addition to his performance work,
Scott
has received numerous accolades for his technical contributions. He was awarded Best Technical Direction for
The Full Monty
and has been recognized for his set designs in productions such as
To Kill a Mockingbird
(Iowa) and
Gruesome Playground Injuries
(Colorado).
Scott
is thrilled to continue his theatrical journey with The Sarasota Players. He credits his success to the unwavering love and support of his family‚Äîhis parents, siblings, mother-in-law‚Äîand especially his partner, Shad, whose encouragement has been invaluable.

about us
The Sarasota Players is Sarasota‚Äôs community theatre, dedicated to delivering quality productions and keeping the community engaged with the arts. The Sarasota Players seeks to provide an artistic outlet for locals and visitors alike to experience live theatre and live theatre training.
The Sarasota Players is a non-professional theatre, located on the ‚ÄúCultural Coast.‚Äù This location gives us an incredible talent pool to work with. Founded in 1929, The Players is celebrating 94 years of bringing the community to the stage. Being the second oldest arts organization in Sarasota and the oldest performing arts organization, The Players is proud to have fostered the budding performing arts scene that has grown into a thriving, theatre-loving community.
In the last nine decades, The Players has become a staple for community members to learn, grow and experience live theatre.¬†The Players Studio teaches all ages and abilities, with no student turned away for their inability to pay thanks to our Building Better Grownups Scholarship Fund.¬†Students can take classes in acting, singing, dance, sewing, directing, as well as specialized workshops and camps. The performing arts help students develop crucial life skills and increases self-esteem and confidence, as well as problem solving and critical thinking. Over 300 students come through The Players Studio each year.
No other venue in town allows patrons to potentially see their friends, relatives, and neighbors fulfill their dream of performing on stage.¬†We are truly local performances, by local performers.¬†We give people a second family, a place to learn about themselves, to hone their skills, to meet new friends and to express themselves creatively.
Our Mission Statement
Entertain, educate, and engage the community through high quality live theatre.

studio faculty
studio faculty
Thayer Greenberg
Director of Education
Thayer Greenberg is the Director of Education at The Players Studio and is proud to bring her extensive background in arts education to the Sarasota Players community. A graduate of Booker High School‚Äôs VPA Theatre Program, Thayer holds a degree in Educational Arts Administration from the University of Massachusetts Amherst and is a master‚Äôs degree in Organizational Leadership from the University of Colorado Boulder. Most recently, she spent four years as the Middle and Upper School Theatre Director at The Out-of-Door Academy in Sarasota. Prior to returning to Florida, Thayer was the founding theatre teacher at the Neighborhood Charter School of Harlem in New York City. She also spent several years teaching in Chicago, where she worked with Child‚Äôs Play Touring Theater, the Columbia College Art Start Summer Program, and served as the Assistant Director of Family Care for The Salvation Army, where she specialized in performing arts education.
Thayer is passionate about creating safe, inclusive spaces where students can be their most authentic selves while receiving a high-quality, competitive theatre education. She is an avid singer and enjoys working with her voice students on vocal health and technique. Thayer is excited for the continued growth of The Players Studio and everything the upcoming season holds for our students and families.

Alan Gillespie
Alan Gillespie-Recently joined The Players Centre for Performing Arts as a Teaching Artist after relocating to Sarasota in 2020 after spending twenty years in New York City as a professional actor. Recent credits include: Network (Nelson Chaney/Continuity Announcer) Florida Studio Theatre, The Full Monty (Jerry Lukowski- Best Actor from BroadwayWorld Kansas City Awards), The Buddy Holly Story (Norm Petty) Mamma Mia (Sam Carmichael) Maples Repertory Theatre, Young Frankenstein (Dr. Fredrick Frankenstein), Peter and the Starcatcher (Black Stache) The Waterfront Playhouse, The Story Of My Life (Thomas Weaver) The Studio Theatre Tierra Del Sol, Mamma Mia (Sam Carmichael) Sierra Repertory Theatre. National Tours: Miss Saigon (Chris-Over 950 Performances ), Showboat (Steve Baker). Tokyo, Japan: The Who‚Äôs Tommy (The Specialist). Regional: Goodspeed Opera House, Westchester Broadway Theatre, Florida Studio Theatre, Mad Cow Theatre, Downtown Cabaret Theatre, New Provincetown Players, Bergen PAC. NYC: Musicals Tonight, Fringe Festival, NYMF, 54Below, Carnegie Hall. Education: Westminster Choir College, The American Musical & Dramatic Academy.
www.alangillespienyc.com
Scott Keys
Scott Keys is a freelance director writer and theatre educator,and recently served as Interim Artistic Director for The Players Centre, Sarasota‚Äôs oldest community theatre, and performed in TPC‚Äôs Side by Side by Sondheim and directed productions of FALSETTOS and SOME ENCHANTED EVENING.
Scott
holds a B.F.A in Musical Theatre Performance from Syracuse University and an M.F.A in Musical Theatre Writing from NYUniversity‚Äôs /, where he was bestowed the Oscar Hammerstein Fellowship for Distinguished Writing as well as outstanding recognition by the Edward Kleban and Jonathan Larson Foundations.
Scott
holds a degree in Secondary Education from Eckerd College and certification as a teacher of The Meisner Technique under the renown Larry Silverberg. He¬† retired in 2021 after¬† more than two decades in public education as a¬† teacher, director, and Chairman of the renowned Booker Visual & Performing Arts High school Theatre dept. where he was he was named Teacher of the Year in 2008, and was recently selected by Broadway World as Arts Educator of the Decade¬† in Sarasota. He was awarded the Distinguished Career Achievement Award for his outstanding contribution to Theatre Education by The Florida Theatre Conference. He has directed over 150 plays and musicals in professional, civic and educational theatres throughout the country, and locally has directed for FST, Sarasota Players, Manatee Players and for Venice Theatre, where he collaborated on the world premiere musical revue UP ON THE ROOF. Also a ¬†published composer, playwright and lyricist,
Scott
served as an Artistic Associate at Playwright‚Äôs Horizons in New York and has had his work produced professionally internationally and throughout the U.S. He is enjoying his new freelance artistic life and continued devotion to his partner of 38 years, David Covach, who is the Director of Costuming at the Asolo Theatre.

Amanda Heisey
Amanda Heisey has been teaching acting and scene study for over 5 years at The Players Studio. Directorial credits include: The Players Teens performance group for 5 years,
The Legend of Sleepy Hollow
for five years, a few silly musicals on The Players¬† MainStage and
Yard Sale the Musical
at Venice Theatre. Favorite theatrical credits include: Velma Kelly in
Chicago
with Dingbat Theatre Project,
A Clockwork Orange
at Jobsite Theatre, and
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
at Venice Theatre. Amanda is excited to be Directing and Teaching Acting this fall, and looks forward to working with students new and old!
Lacey Knispel
Lacey Knispel has been teaching theatre to students of all ages for over a decade. She studied at the University of South Florida, and holds a degree in elementary education and a certification in theatre. She is currently the theatre director at Sarasota High School and is also the director of Sarasota High School‚Äôs All Access Theatre Company, an educational theatre group dedicated to making theatre accessible to students of all abilities. She has enjoyed her time on studio faculty teaching theatre, dance, directing The Players Kids performance group, and building the summer mini camp program.
Logan Junkins
Logan Junkins has been part of The Players Studio for many years, specializing in Adult Dance, Musical Theater, The Players Follies, and Choreographing the Kids musical each year.
Logan graduated from the American Musical and Dramatic Academy as a dance theatre major. He toured with Sesame Street Live and even competed professionally in ballroom, tap, and musical theatre.
He has been in a theater for the majority of his life learning everything he can, and in many departments. Logan is happy to share his experiences, and knowledge of being a performer to growing performers of all ages.
Brian Finnerty
Brian F. Finnerty is a director, choreographer, performer, instructor, costume designer, stage manager, and scenic designer. Brian studied Theater performance at Point Park University, and is a graduate of Booker High schools VPA theater program. ¬†Brian is the Production Manager for Raven Mystery Games and Co-Artistic Director at Dingbat Theatre Project. He‚Äôs educated on the Suncoast for over twelve years and has had many students go on to work professionally in the arts. His Favorite directorial / choreography credits include: The Drowsy Chaperone, Beauty & the Beast Jr., Moana Jr. (The Players Studio), Chicago, Hedwig & The Angry Inch, The SpongeBob Musical, Shrek the Musical (Dingbat Theatre Project), Reefer Madness, Vaudeville‚Äôs Dead (The Starlite Room), YANK! A WWII Love Story (Manatee Performing Arts Center), Little Shop of Horrors, Godspell, Head Over Heels, Shout! The Mod Musical, All Shook Up, and Hello, Dolly! (The Players Centre), and Beauty & the Beast, Silence the Musical, Six Women with Brain Death (Venice Theatre). When Brian has a second away from the theatre, he loves to go on rollercoasters, pet his four cats, eat mac n‚Äô cheese, and watch the Jurassic Park movies. ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt wait to work with the wonderful students of TPS for another great season!‚Äù
AJ Trinci
AJ Trinci is an experienced performer and improviser who latched on to the local theater scene at the age of ten and has since earned a BFA in Musical Theater from Florida State University, trained with the Upright Citizens Brigade School of Improv in New York City, and appeared in several regional theater productions and short comedy films. AJ has also had the pleasure of playing with the locally acclaimed FST improv team and appearing in The Players‚Äô recent production of Fun Home. They are so excited to be able to share the improvisational techniques that have helped to unlock their creativity and enhance their performances, as well as having a positive impact on their social and problem solving skills.
Victoria Leyva
Victoria is a Sunshine State native and a 2022 graduate of New College of Florida, where she earned her B.A. in Art History. Proficient in ballet, tap, jazz, and contemporary, she honed her technique at North Port High School before deepening her understanding of movement with Sarasota Contemporary Dance.
When she‚Äôs not teaching, she enjoys baking, going to the beach, and spending quality time with her loved ones. Victoria is thrilled to bring her energy and passion for dance to The Players!
